Should have appreciation for nuances while executing multi country transformation programs‚Ä¢	The candidate should be able to abstract solution complexities while at the same time should possess skills to deep dive on any technical / non- technical topics‚Ä¢	Experience in delivering enterprise level integration projects preferably on an Software AG Webmethods platform‚Ä¢	Experience of the Linux Operating System‚Ä¢	Understanding of the Java technology stack ( J2EE, POJO, SPRING)‚Ä¢	Should be able to do code review on Java and  Webmethods technology‚Ä¢	Criticality analyse Integration flows/ patterns and check for compliance with Bank Integration strategy‚Ä¢	Deep understanding of Messaging platforms like JMS, MQ, AMQP, MQTT‚Ä¢	Knowledge of Devops tools like Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift, Ansible‚Ä¢	Extensive Experience in Object Oriented Design and Analysis‚Ä¢	Good understanding of REST based Architecture with hand on experience  on Modeling Resources and URI‚Ä¢	Ability to articulate concepts of Service Oriented Architecture and Business Process Management (and Optimisation) to both technical and non-technical audiences‚Ä¢	Senior stakeholder management and the ability to effectively communicate technical architecture and non-functional requirementsApply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. title: Supply Chain Optimization Engineer
description: Supply Chain Optimization EngineerSingaporeWho We Are:Lumileds is the leading global light engine company serving customers in automotive lighting, general illumination, and consumer market segments. Lumileds operates in over 30 countries and has approximately 7,000 employees, Lumileds is shaping the future of light with the most innovative technology in the illumination and automotive sectors, and helping our customers deliver differentiated solutions to the world. Lumileds is headquartered in San Jose, California, with operations in Singapore, Malaysia and the Netherlands and sales offices throughout the world.Together with its customers, Lumileds is making the world better, safer, more beautiful‚Äîwith light.The Lumileds environment is fast-paced, cutting-edge, intelligent and fun! We are looking for exceptional talent to join our team! To learn more, visit Lumileds.comPosition Summary:As Supply Chain  Optimization Engineer you lead improvement projects defined in the supply  chain roadmap. Further, you assist in the development of a process oriented  organization. The improvement projects are generally focused around supporting   developing state of the art planning  scheduling solutions which  help the organization to deal with the growth of the business as well as  handling complexity of existing product flows. Next to working on individual  projects, you are expected to proactively contribute to the supply chain  roadmap by sharing best practices and highlighting opportunities for  improvement.  The scope of your role  will be on all supply chain processes at all three Lumileds sites‚Äì San Jose,  Penang and Singapore.What You Will Do:  To execute projects in a timely manner following the Agile frame work with focus on planning  scheduling related problems.  Support  further develop our customised planning  execution solutions ensuring that the applications can continue to support the business and planners use the applications to best of their capabilities  Provide first  second level support to SOP solver and act as back-up for other solvers managed out of Singapore. This includes supporting complicated Demand  Supply analysis as part of the monthly SOP process.  Analyze existing methodology and implement a robust process improvements which result in inventory reduction and or service level improvements  Drive consolidation towards harmonized supply chain process  Provide coaching and training of new methodology and tools to peers throughout functions via workshops, project reporting and formalized training.What You Will Bring (REQUIRED Qualifications):  Experience in leading projects  operational experience  in a multidisciplinary, international organization (preferably within  semiconductor industry and supply chain area).  Strong business acumen is required with knowledge in using  optimization programs like IBM CPLEX, IBM ODMe (or similar commercial solver  based applications like Oracle SNO, JDA SP/PP, Gurobi etc.) with an  understanding of Linear Programming and/or Constraint programming concepts.  Familiarity of ERP systems and SAP experience is preferred.  Familiarity with java or .net development framework will be  an added advantage. PMP certification is a plus.  Excellent communication and conceptual skills (analysis,  integration, vision and sense of reality).  Capable of convincing Sr. Management, manage different type  and level of stakeholders and deal with resistance.  Ability to set the right  priorities and translate supply chain optimization problems into tangible  solutions.Education (Minimum Level)  MastersField of Study  Operations research,  Industrial Engineering, MathematicsYears of Experience (Minimum)  Masters holder with 5 years experience.

title: Senior Manager - IT Innovation (Logistics Ind / West)
description: Our client is the key partner for supply chain solutions to the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) and provide commercialized solution which is the backbone of the SAF supply chain.Job Summary:The Head of Innovation leads and sets the direction for executing cross-functional and regional innovation programmes from initiation to completion. He directs a team of professionals and third-party vendors or service providers towards reaching organisational goals related to programmes. He manages risks that affect the delivery of outcomes. He designs, develops and implements operating policies.As one who directs multiple Innovation programmes, he adopts a broad, global perspective and is confident in making critical decisions and handles competing resource needs with implications on various projects and stakeholders. He is an excellent leader who has a passion for mentoring and developing professionals in the team.He/She holds department management and administration responsibilities including the overall management of project teams and development of staff. title: Client Onboarding Manager
description: OSL, Asia‚Äôs leading digital asset platform and member of BC Technology Group Limited (stock code: 863 HK) (‚ÄúBC Group‚Äù), is the first firm to become licensed by the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) to conduct Type 1 (dealing in securities) and Type 7 (automated trading service (ATS)) regulated activities, and is now the world‚Äôs first SFC-licensed, listed, digital asset wallet-insured, Big-4 audited digital asset trading platform for institutions and professional investors.The company offers OTC, iRFQ and electronic trading services giving traders access to the world‚Äôs deepest liquidity pools, digital asset borrowing and lending, as well as secure, insured wallets to ensure the safekeeping of digital assets with timely transaction settlement.OSL is the trusted gateway to the digital asset economy.For further details, see https://bc.group/.Job ScopeClient onboarding is a critical function at OSL. The candidate will be a key member of a growing team working closely with client/ counterparts and serving internal business partners who develop the processes and controls, and help to specify the systems that deliver accuracy, timeless and integrity to our business.Responsibilities  To perform the due diligence on individual, corporate and institutional clients including information/data collection, checking, validation and verification. To comply with internal policies and regulatory requirements (AML/KYC/CTF)  for client onboarding in the jurisdiction which our group entities operate. Strong knowledge of relevant regulations related to client onboarding due diligence including AML  CTF Ordinance.  Interest to explore and develop a career in the digital asset industry  Positive attitude to handle multiple tasks in a highly competitive environment  Good communications and interpersonal skills, fluency in spoken and written English is required. title: VP, Business Analyst (Avaloq), Consumer Banking Technology, Technology & Operations (WD23121)
description: Business FunctionGroup Technology and Operations (TO) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality  control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group TO, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Job PurposeAs a Business System Analyst (BSA), you will be responsible for developing technical solutions to business problems. This usually begins with defining, analysing and documenting the requirements. Managing requirements at the project level can help fulfil business needs. Solutions often include a software-systems development component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development.The candidate should value simplicity and impact, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and have the ability and desire to learn. Candidate also require having greater flexibility, greater discipline, and the willingness to work in an evolutionary manner.Key Accountabilities  Work with business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business process, establishing project scope and goals. Facilitate conflict resolution and be able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective.  Develop, execute and manage the project plan, and take corrective actions when project deviates from plan.  Coordinate with business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases.  Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues.  Initiate User Requests (Request for Service) for enhancements on behalf of the business.Responsibilities  Bridge the communication between the development team and business stakeholders, by providing the details explaining the requirements to the team.  To identify stakeholder needs, negotiate priorities between repeating stakeholder factions, and then collaborate with developers to ensure that the requirements are implemented effectively.  Provide clarity in business requirement to allow developers to provision estimates, and serve to represent stakeholders, to provide business priorities.  Act as an SME in the respective domain with sufficient knowledge to interact, solicit requirements, and advise business users on the best solutions  Help develop compelling and innovative solutions while complying with existing standards, guidelines, and processes  Perform end-to-end technical impact analysis and lead the requirement gathering with business users. Propose alternate solutions to meet or improve the desired objectives based on best practices and industry solutions and influence the desired outcomes  Verify that the user requirements are achievable and support business users during UAT and post-implementation phases  Effectively translate user stories/ pain points into technical specification details and collaborate with various development teams to produce high quality deliverables  Review test cases and help resolve requirement/implementation issues during testing phase  Perform Proof of concept before project inceptionRequirements  Must have the ability to investigate and understand how the business works.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and specify requirements to solve business problems.  Ability to facilitate and elicit requirements.  Significant and solid understanding of software development life cycle.  Demonstrable experience of ability to identify the business needs of stakeholders who will be impacted by the change and understand their influence and authority. Significant and demonstrable experience of RDBMS  Experience in facilitation skills for requirement workshop planning, ability to manage requirements during requirement change management.  Understand conduct interface analysis, the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.  At least 5-7 years + of development or system design working experience  Proven experience of having solved complex analytical and technical problems  Strong analytical skills and proven ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex analytical outcomes, linkages and messages  Strong business and technology knowledge on Wealth product offering and processes  Strong team player and interpersonal skills  Self-starter and motivated  Ability to perform technical impact analysis independently and resourceful in finding information required  Strong believe in doing the right thing in offering solutions  Ability to multi-task and effectively organize him/herself to achieve the objective  Proficient with various tools for collaboration and issue management as well as agile software and development  Prior experience and technical knowledge on Avaloq is a mustApply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantage

title: AVP, Business Analyst (Avaloq), Consumer Banking Technology, Technology & Operations (WD23121)
description: Business FunctionGroup Technology and Operations (TO) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality  control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group TO, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.Job PurposeAs a Business System Analyst (BSA), you will be responsible for developing technical solutions to business problems. This usually begins with defining, analysing and documenting the requirements. Managing requirements at the project level can help fulfil business needs. Solutions often include a software-systems development component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development.The candidate should value simplicity and impact, work comfortably in a collaborative, agile environment, and have the ability and desire to learn. Candidate also require having greater flexibility, greater discipline, and the willingness to work in an evolutionary manner.Key Accountabilities  Work with business stakeholders on solution requirement including mapping business process, establishing project scope and goals.  Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure requirements are clear and delivered successfully.  Collaborate with delivery teams to ensure solution design is optimized for efficiency.  Facilitate conflict resolution and be able to influence business and technical stakeholders towards a common objective.  Develop, execute and manage the project plan, and take corrective actions when project deviates from plan.  Coordinate with business and technical stakeholders to ensure smooth cutover during schedule releases.  Work with business and production management teams to prioritize and resolve critical production issues.  Initiate User Requests (Request for Service) for enhancements on behalf of the business.Responsibilities  Bridge the communication between the development team and business stakeholders, by providing the details explaining the requirements to the team.  To identify stakeholder needs, negotiate priorities between repeating stakeholder factions, and then collaborate with developers to ensure that the requirements are implemented effectively.  Provide clarity in business requirement to allow developers to provision estimates, and serve to represent stakeholders, to provide business priorities.  Act as an SME in the respective domain with sufficient knowledge to interact, solicit requirements, and advise business users on the best solutions  Help develop compelling and innovative solutions while complying with existing standards, guidelines, and processes  Perform end-to-end technical impact analysis and lead the requirement gathering with business users. Propose alternate solutions to meet or improve the desired objectives based on best practices and industry solutions and influence the desired outcomes  Verify that the user requirements are achievable and support business users during UAT and post-implementation phases  Effectively translate user stories/ pain points into technical specification details and collaborate with various development teams to produce high quality deliverables  Review test cases and help resolve requirement/implementation issues during testing phase  Perform Proof of concept before project inceptionRequirements  Must have the ability to investigate and understand how the business works.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and specify requirements to solve business problems.  Ability to facilitate and elicit requirements.  Significant and solid understanding of software development life cycle.  Demonstrable experience of ability to identify the business needs of stakeholders who will be impacted by the change and understand their influence and authority. Significant and demonstrable experience of RDBMS  Experience in facilitation skills for requirement workshop planning, ability to manage requirements during requirement change management.  Understand conduct interface analysis, the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.  At least 5-7 years + of development or system design working experience  Proven experience of having solved complex analytical and technical problems  Strong analytical skills and proven ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex analytical outcomes, linkages and messages  Strong business and technology knowledge on Wealth product offering and processes  Strong team player and interpersonal skills  Self-starter and motivated  Ability to perform technical impact analysis independently and resourceful in finding information required  Strong believe in doing the right thing in offering solutions  Ability to multi-task and effectively organize him/herself to achieve the objective  Proficient with various tools for collaboration and issue management as well as agile software and development  Prior experience and technical knowledge on Avaloq is a mustApply NowWe offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

title: Frontend Tech Lead, Customer Service Platform
description: Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.The Customer Service Platform (CSP) is a team that integrate the product technology resources of the company's internal customer service system. Sc or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields from accredited and reputable institutions- 5+ years experience in developing frontend web applications, with demonstrable expertise in deep optimisation of end user experience, stability  scalability, code modularity and rendering latency- Demonstrable experience in development of complex web platforms, able to plan and execute targeted optimization in performance, engineering efficiency and other key areas- Strong JavaScript/HTML/CSS frontend engineering experience and strong familiarity with key concepts including asynchronous programming, closures and types, layouts, specificity, animation, cross browser compatibility and accessibility- Deep understanding of the underlying design philosophy and implementation of common web frameworks, including React/Vue/Angular- Deep familiarity and experience with common web compilation and bundling frameworks, including Webpack/Rollup/BaBel/AST/Gulp- Good understanding of frontend - backend multi-tier application architecture and protocols, familiarity with product and software development lifecycle process- Experience in development of no-code/low-code platforms is highly advantageousIDEAL CANDIDATE1. Agile, quick self learner, highly self-motivated with strong sense of product ownership and creative problem solver2. Deeply passionate about software coding/development and building great mobile/web applications3. Ability to lead independent research to solve complex technical problems4. Empathetic and results oriented leader and mentor5. Good collaborator and team player, comfortable working in a fast moving, culturally diverse and globally distributed team environment

title: Public Health Analyst Trainee
description: Traineeship Description: The trainee will have the opportunity to work with experienced Public Health Managers  Consultants to support the design, development and delivery of consulting projects to our clients in the healthcare industry, mainly global health donor organizations and governments. Assignments range in complexity from evaluating and scoping opportunities, research analysis and problem solving to assisting the development of recommendations and presenting them for clients. Depending on the nature of tasks, you may work closely with other business units including the Consulting, Primary Intelligence, Real World Insights, Data and Technology Solutions teams.Specific Responsibilities:   Assist with business development (e.g. opportunities identification and scoping) and proposal writing for untapped public health segments:  Conducting primary and secondary research, and performing quantitative and qualitative analyses to identify client issues and develop client recommendations  Support Public Health project delivery: Creating reports, presentations and other client deliverables, and supporting client meetings and workshops  Support Strategy Development: Developing strategies and evaluating opportunities for global health donor organizations, life science companies, and governments in developing Asia markets Technical Skills and Competencies:  Develop intermediate level of knowledge in one or few of these areas: healthcare, health economics, public health, public policy, epidemiology, life sciences  Understand who are the main global health organisations (e.g. donor/funding agencies, NGOs), governments (e.g. policymakers, regulators) and life science companies  Good degree of comfort with handling data sets (qualitative  quantitative), finding insights in unstructured data, and rapidly evolving project focus / tasks  Develop strong written and verbal communication skills  Develop strong interpersonal skills for working in teams and within the organization  Develop strong problem solving, analytical  project management skills

title: Head of Product Design
description: About the Role We are looking for the head of product design to join our ranks to help us shape the future of fintech in Indonesia and be the fairest financial services company in the region. As a product design leader, you will provide the creative vision for the company and define processes and practices to achieve this vision. You would be accountable for the overall user experience of all our products and ensure we deliver quality products to our users.What you‚Äôll do:‚Ä¢ You will lead the team that designs all of company‚Äôs products offerings ‚Ä¢ Work with Product and Business teams to help define the roadmap to achieve our goals and vision‚Ä¢ Work with design leads, product heads, and engineers to build and improve user experience to help achieve   our OKRs ‚Ä¢ Build and refine the overall design process, practices, and guidelines and evangelize the same within the      organization ‚Ä¢ Partner with research and customer support teams to understand our users, their problems, and behaviors. ‚Ä¢ Define communication and collaboration principles between design and other teams‚Ä¢ Interpret abstract business concepts and turn them into creative ideas ‚Ä¢ Partner with the marketing team to define our branding guidelines and positioning ‚Ä¢ Hiring, developing, mentoring, and inspiring the design team to constantly strive for excellence in performance ‚Ä¢ Present design plans and briefs to senior stakeholders and drive alignment‚Ä¢ Help the organization build delightful products that our customers love What you‚Äôll need: ‚Ä¢ At least 8 years of experience in design with a minimum of 2 years spent in leading and managing design teams ‚Ä¢ Proficiency in product design with expertise in visual hierarchy and practical knowledge of design fundamentals   like design thinking and human-centered design to build products‚Ä¢ The knack to find solutions that satisfy business needs, the user needs, and are within the technical limitations‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders and take a structured approach to solve problems‚Ä¢ Experience in optimizing conversion funnels through design iterations‚Ä¢ Expertise in working with research and data teams to make design decisions and draw insights based on    qualitative and quantitative data ‚Ä¢ High proficiency with Figma, Invision, Sketch, Adobe CC, or other similar design platforms‚Ä¢ A deep sense of accountability, adaptability, and embracing ambiguity working in a fast-paced environment ‚Ä¢ Excellent leadership and managerial skills, demonstrated by the ability to communicate a vision and inspire and  motivate others to action

title: QA Engineer
description: We are seeking a QA Engineer responsible for the design and creation of test plans and test cases to identify bugs or issues with web and mobile applications. This position requires the creation of automated test cases and performing manual testing. The candidate should have a keen eye for details and be meticulous about writing  reports and documentation.Overall Job ObjectivesEnsure that applications both web and mobile are thoroughly tested at all stages of deployment by leveraging a combination of QA best practices,  frameworks and automation tools. Ensuring that only high quality software products are shipped is of the utmost importance.Core Responsibilities | As a QA Engineer, you will:  Analyses requirements to develop and enhance software test plan for new features with systematic approach.  Perform software testing based on manual and/or automated test cases and analyzing and documenting test results.  Take full ownership of and maintain QA environment  Test product at all levels from user interface, workflows, application and performance.  Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with different teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.  Working closely with multi-site developers to design and create test conditions to address technical and customer use cases.  Prepare good analytical reports and to review findings with the team to recommend corrective action.  Provide support to the field service team for technical questions concerning software.  Have a good understanding of the software release cycle.Job Specifications | Requirements:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Software Engineering or related field.  Minimum 1 ‚Äì 3 years of relevant working experience in software QA.  Exceptional attention to details and quality.  Excellent analytical and problem solving skill, able to debug issues efficiently.  Great team player, proactive and able to work efficiently with minimal supervision.  Experience in eCommerce is a plus.  Should have coding experience and hands-on with automation (Web, Mobile app and API automation)  Knowledge of tools such as Postman, JMeter and TestComplete etc  Experience with CI/CD  Excellent communication, and analytical skills  Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies  Understanding of Java, Python, SQL, and JSON.

title: Services Manager, gCare - Singapore
description: The area: gTech (general)Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech‚Äôs role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers‚Äô complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.brbrTo learn more about gTech, check out our a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcjR6ZngQcw"video/a.The role: Services Manager, gCare - SingaporeBusinesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Additional Role Description:Working within the broader gTech organization, the Large Customer Sales (LCS) Services Management team provides engagement and service satisfaction for Google‚Äôs LCS team and advertising customers. Our team bridges the Google Sales and gTech Services organizations to deliver the best solutions and customer experience for our advertisers.As a gCare Services Manager, you will work closely with LCS, gCare teams and Go-to-Markets to bring the best of technical solutions and troubleshooting services to LCS accounts. Aligning closely with the sales strategy, you will provide both proactive and reactive recommendations to Sales team members on relevant gTech services and coordinate with our Specialist teams to ensure an excellent experience. You will collaborate with gTech colleagues to design outstanding advertiser solutions and experiences, deploy innovative methods for service engagement, and incorporate the latest sales strategies into service offerings.Responsibilities:- Represent gCare services across vendor-led implementation support, business growth enablement through optimization and product adoption, and billing and policy issues for your LCS markets .- Conduct opportunity analysis and make recommendations to the Sales team on where and how gTech can drive value for advertisers.- Partner with the Sales team to drive activation, engagement, and satisfaction with gTech services and solutions, leveraging influence and customer service knowledge to drive continuous improvement.- Engage effectively with sellers and sales leaders, interacting daily to activate solutions, drive process outcomes, and enable actionable resolution to escalations from the business.- Manage and represent gCare relationships by collaborating extensively with gCare, LCS, Troubleshooting, and Policy teams to represent a unified gCare point of view with the LCS business in collaboration with our gCare leads/owners.Minimum qualifications:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.- 5 years of experience in service management, sales, client management, operations, or consulting.Preferred qualifications:- Experience working on a global team.- Ability to manage multiple global projects simultaneously while paying attention to detail.- Ability to think strategically and analyze the needs of stakeholders, while managing ambiguity and complexity.- Ability to synthesize complex messages, data sets/signals, and insights into executive-ready communications.- Excellent project management, problem-solving, and analysis skills, combined with business acumen.

title: Tech Lead (SRE/DBA), Technology Architecture
description: Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin and Toutiao. ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, and fault-tolerant systems. Infrastructure SRE ensures that ByteDance's infrastructure services reliability and uptime appropriate to the needs of users and fast iterations of improvement. Our software development pays great attention to optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure, and eliminating work through automation.As a Tech Lead, you will be responsible for leading and building a team of software/system engineers with your excellent technical leadership. You are expected to set up necessary processes for efficient execution and advocate good engineering practices. You will also regularly coordinate and communicate with other infrastructure teams as well as our users.Responsibilities- Building and managing SRE/DBA team, including team recruitment, new talent training, system operation/maintenance/coordination and team culture building.- Develop a long-term technical plan, have a clear implementation path and milestones, continuously ensure the competitiveness of the team and technology.- Formulate process specifications and plans with regards to access, configuration, disaster recovery as well as fault handling for all critical paths of the operating platform.- Design and implement software platforms as well as monitor frameworks for efficient, automated, and intelligent service-oriented architecture (SOA) governance.- Cooperate with the system development team to ensure system reliability throughout the entire life cycle from system design to launch. Continuously evolve automated operation, maintenance facilities and platforms.- Strengthen communication and cooperation with business teams, improve cross-team coordination, ensure continuous improvement and optimization of business flows. Promote the evolution of business architecture design.Qualifications- Bachelor degree or above in Computer Science or a related technical discipline with 5+ years working experience (3+ years of RD experience).- Systematic in operation and maintenance thinking. Familiar with Linux systems and network skills. Practical experience with large-scale distributed system operations and maintenance systems.- Self-driven with the ability to plan and summarize well. Experienced with project and team management.- Possesses a strong sense of responsibility, a proactive team spirit, and a strong ability to comprehensively analyze and solve problems.- Experience with large-scale cloud-computing platforms is preferred.- Experience with large-scale distributed storage, scheduling, big data computing system development or intelligent operation and maintenance is preferred.

title: General Program Manager, Finance - Singapore
description: The area: FinanceThe name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.The role: General Program Manager, Finance - SingaporeAdditional Role Description:The Revenue to Cash Operations team manages Google's Order-to-Cash (O2C) processes globally across all product areas, including Ads, Digital Goods, Cloud and Hardware. We ensure Google‚Äôs business growths are transformed to cash in an efficient, controlled and compliant manner. Our team powers Google's ambitious growth agenda by creating innovative ways to manage our complex set of billing and payment transactions, making processes more efficient and scalable, minimizing operational risk, integrating Google acquisitions and new products, connecting with new payment and invoicing partners and so much more.In this role, you will be a process design expert, an experienced project manager including process improvement/optimization, and an excellent business partner to your finance, engineering, and business stakeholders. You will exhibit impeccable commercial judgment, regularly engaging with executive stakeholders across Google to balance cash, cost, and customer satisfaction. You will find innovative ways to manage our complex set of processes making them more efficient and scalable. You will work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you will proactively minimize operational risk.Responsibilities:- Partner with global colleagues to identify opportunities and implement solutions through process improvement and/or automation.- Identify and drive resolution on areas of opportunity to drive tool process efficiency improvement.- Limit business and legal risk and establish program metrics by setting, defining and aligning with leadership on target metrics and key performance indicators.- Use proactive management and strategic planning of contracts and vendor performance management.- Be an advocate, educator, consultant and advisor on many levelsMinimum qualifications:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.- 4 years of experience in consulting, external workforce operations, or business process re-engineering.Preferred qualifications:- Experience in data extraction using SQL or other scripting languages.- Experience working in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment leading complex operational initiatives to successful outcomes.- Experience in process design/re-engineering.- Ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization and to communicate across all levels.- Ability to autonomously identify, prioritize, and drive multiple initiatives.

title: Crisis Manager, APAC
description: Job Summary:The APAC Security Crisis Management (CM) mission is to collaborate with key business partners and customers to support all Disney (and its affiliates) employees in building, sustaining and improving Disney‚Äôs capability to prepare for, respond to and recover from all hazards. This is accomplished by four approaches: plan development, training and exercising developed plans, implementing the use of technology for emergency use and partnership with internal and external stakeholders.Responsibilities:  Provide emergency response technical expertise for exercises, drills and training  Administer the region-wide employee training, preparedness and exercise programmes leveraging existing technologies such as webinars, VTC, etc. to reach remote locations and expand the programme‚Äôs impact  Monitor and support all Regional Crisis Events, man-made or natural, to ensure APAC Security Management has complete Situational Awareness and is able to make informed decisions.  Develop and implement Regional Tier 1  2 Crisis Management plans  Support all Crisis Management regional-wide operational preparedness including communications, response procedures, escalation thresholds, crisis management centres and logistical arrangements  Develops, maintains and delivers a region-wide annual training and exercise programme  Support the invocation of crisis and emergency response operations as outlined in the Regional CM plan  Identify, brief and train the Tier 1, 2  3 participants across the region  Support Regional Security managers in the local preparation an implementation of site Emergency and Incident management plans  Lead on the implementation and uptake of the Global Emergency Notification System  Support APAC Business Units and functions in the preparation and implementation of Business Continuity Plans  Benchmark best practice for CM development and execution in a large international corporate environment  Review current and evolving technologies to optimise the regional CM delivery platformAreas of Accountability:  Accountable to the Vice President, Global Security APAC  ME for the delivery of all Incident and Crisis Management related regional objectives, tasks and activities  To collaborate with the Global Crisis Management Team to synthesise CM standards, plans, training, skills and capability across the region  Responsible for the development of the regional, escalation, communications and response reporting between the APAC CM Command Centre and the Global Command Centre during a crisis  Responsible for the briefing, training, exercising and capability of participants in the Tier 1  2 Crisis Management Teams  Support to the Regional Security Managers to design and implement emergency and incident response plans at sites and for ad hoc events  Collaboration with Global CM to develop and implement a comprehensive programme of scenario training and exercising across APAC  Development of budgets to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of the Regional Crisis Management Command Centre  Design and develop fully capable Tier 1  2 Crisis Command CentresBasic Qualifications:  Proven track record of Crisis Management development and delivery in a large multi-national corporate entity  Expert trainer able to inspire and influence busy executives to engage with the CM programme  Proven ability to design and deliver well thought through, relevant and challenging exercise scenarios to multiple CM tiers at the same time  Able to work through dual reporting lines:  accountable for delivery of regional objectives and tasking‚Äôs whilst collaborating and liaising with the Global Central Team  Excellent stakeholder management skills seeking to implement plans and enhance the capability of CM across all sites in APAC  Experienced in engaging with business and functional stakeholders to develop realistic and deliverable business continuity plans  Ability to work independently, think critically, and experience in oral and written communications and presentation skills  Experienced in managing and/or advising crisis management teams in dealing with fast moving crisis events  Works well under pressure and can organise and gain the focus of crisis leadership teams in order to make rapid decisions with limited information  A strong service focus with the need to listen and understand the essential requirements of different client groups  Experience of working in large matrix organisations where persuading and influencing decisions across multiple stakeholders is key to success  A flexible approach to variable working hours/travel requirements is essentialThe Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

title: Account Strategist, Traditional Media Agency, Google Customer Solutions - Singapore
description: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS)When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.The role: Account Strategist, Traditional Media Agency, Google Customer Solutions - SingaporeBusinesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.Additional Role Description:The Traditional Agency Sales team is a sales team that cultivates customer success by partnering with a wide range of traditional media agencies.Our Agency Account Strategists are customer-focused initial-line sellers who serve as the contact of Google, offering the best solutions Google has to offer. As an Account Strategist, you will activate initiatives across agency and end-customers by improving account and campaign performance, driving thoughtful Google product adoption, and designing short, medium and long-term strategies to meet customer business objectives. You will collaborate with our teams of technicians, analysts, and solution specialists to analyze and solve customer challenges, engaging with industry opportunities and delivering a great customer experience.Responsibilities:- Manage a portfolio of businesses by understanding growth drivers, identifying opportunities for growth, managing risks, and building quarterly plans for achievements.- Drive customer growth by delivering outstanding customer business experience and achieving customer business and marketing objectives.- Own the business process by driving customer outreach, business pitches, solution implementation, and performance evaluation.- Work towards quarterly business and product growth goals.Minimum qualifications:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.- 3 years of experience in Digital Media and/or Advertising Sales.Preferred qualifications:- Experience with Sales in a technology, advertising, media sales, and/or internet environment.- Experience with Google Ads and YouTube account management, managing advertising, and/or media campaigns.- Media experience across a variety of platforms (e.g., TV, Radio, Print, Sponsorship, etc.).- Experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously while paying attention to detail.- Ability to multitask and thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking, and analytical skills.

title: Broker (LNG)
description: Corporate Culture and Guiding Principles:Tullett Prebon, part of TP ICAP group, operates at the heart of the world‚Äôs financial, energy and commodities markets.We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world‚Äôs financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy  Commodities.Globally, we are a leading provider of services to market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It‚Äôs supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities.We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity, and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.Responsibilities:  Promote Tullett Prebon as a company  Maintain and develop existing client relationships and make contact with prospective new clients where appropriate  Maintain an up to date knowledge of the products and markets in which you work; actively solicit feedback from industry participants through various means, including trade calls, surveys, industry events, trade shows and conferences  Understand the desk‚Äôs business strategy and seek to identify new business opportunities relating to trends, future markets, products and clients  On-board new clients following the correct process with the Client On-Boarding team  Assess client needs and financial conditions to identify internal cross selling opportunities  Understand pertinent regulation within the evolving regulatory landscape  Support a risk and compliance aware culture and comply with group policies  Exercise independent judgement and act with integrity, care, skill and diligence to avoid conflicts of interest and escalate issues as appropriateRisk Related Responsibilities:* Ensure that you understand the risks and controls on your desk; what could go wrong, what controls you have to prevent/detect or contain these.  Ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility  Report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/or your supervisor as described in the policy  Escalate risk events immediately and log them within 24 hours using the risk event capture form on the intranet  Provide input if requested to the Risk and Control Self-Assessment process, scenario analysis ‚ÄòDeep Dive‚Äô reviews and any other risk management processes as required.  Report all loss events, or near misses that could have resulted in a loss, in excess of the reporting threshold  Observe proper standards of market conduct and ensure you are aware of, understand and comply with all regulatory, exchange or clearing house requirements applicable to your role  Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines  Ensure that you adhere to the terms of any applicable Desk ManualRequired Registrations:To ensure the Group complies with its regulatory requirements, all employees performing regulatory or client facing roles need to be appropriately registered and authorised prior to dealing with or for its clients. Employees are responsible for assessing, in conjunction with their Line Manager and Compliance, whether they require authorisation by any supervisory body to perform a particular role. Prior to reviewing and confirming whether you are or require to be an approved person, please liaise with your Line Manager or speak with the Compliance Team.Person Specification:Client Focused  Personable and engaging  Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders  Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible  Demonstrates strong customer focus  Demonstrate ability to work effectively with others  Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution  Ability to work with diverse groups/ personalitiesInnovative  Open to innovative ideas/experiences and ability to create new ideas, approaches or insights  Seeks opportunities for improvements  Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativityDynamic  Competitive  Demonstrates high levels of energy in seeking out and achieving new goals  Goes that ‚Äúextra mile‚Äù  Is a self-starter  Shows evidence of being comfortable working in fast paced or pressured environments  Enjoys a challenge and is able to escalate  Does not give up easilyOpen  Communicative  Adapts communication style to suit audience  Projects personal credibility  Interacts confidently without being overbearing  Ability to work effectively in a high pressure environment  Keeps emotions under control in difficult situations  Handles criticism constructivelyProfessional Integrity  Able to demonstrate honesty, integrity and professionalism  Promotes loyalty to TP ICAP and its principles  Works ethically and shows respect for both professional and company valuesEffective  Excellent attention to detail, highly organised with a proactive approach  Strong analytical ability and problem solving skillsKnowledge  Understanding  Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy  Willingness to engage with internal and external stakeholders outside of the immediate desk environment  Prior experience in Energy  Commodities markets of 3 ‚Äì 5 years

title: Financial Accountant ‚ÄìSTF and Quant Trading with global commodity trading MNC
description: Financial Accountant ‚ÄìSTF and Quant Trading with global commodity trading MNC  Min 7 to 11 years of accounting experience  Experience in Financial Service/ banking is required (but does not require STF and Quant Trading exp)  Experience in setting up the finance function for a new business is preferred but not a mustOur client is a renowned/global commodity MNC with an international presence. It offers a good work environment with attractive benefits (e.g. 25 days leave, good medical and insurance coverage covering immediate family members). For this role, you are a financial acct supporting its global iron ore marketing business.For this role, you will provide finance/accounting support for a newly set up division covering Structured Trade Finance (STF) and Quant Trading.Job DescriptionDrive efficient and effective Finance operations  You will drive the engine room of the Finance function, managing payments to and from counterparties all the way to ensuring preparing and reviewing that all transactions are appropriately recorded in an effective manner within agreed timelines.  Work within the framework of our financial controls and accounting policies, and engages closely with Risk, Group Shared Services and the wider Finance team to formulate, implement and perform robust controls and ensure documentation of key Finance processes. This has to be in line with upcoming UK ICFR requirements.  Design/ optimise process to communicate transaction information across to GSS, ensuring adherence to workflow controls and eliminating manual intervention.Deliver on-demand information  The role plays a key role in ensuring data integrity and making information available for on-demand to support commercial decisions and new business initiatives. It works closely with Business Partnering and other stakeholders to design and implement the technical accounting logic to align data streams with business activities from financial and performance reporting perspectives while managing the systems and processes to capture and deliver them as efficiently and accurately as possible.  Responsible for completion of reporting monthly results in an accurate, compliant and timely manner which includes coordination and collection of information from all relevant sources in delivering Monthly Financial Statements, Board papers and other regular information as required by the Marketing Business, Production Business Units or Group.Technology transformation  Working closely with IM, the role looks to implement technologies that improve control, increase information available for the business and automate transactional activity as much as possible, freeing up the team to add value elsewhere. It needs to think differently about the work Finance does and how it gets done, including the elimination of manual journals and recons as a cost to quality.Project and Continuous improvement  The lead to setup financial reporting process for the new trading activities within marketing for specific commodity team. Optimise links between SAP, Aspect, HFM and other systems to ensure information is readily available. Design and improve processes around the systems to streamline efforts required to input and extract data. Drive standardization and automation of processes via continual improvements.Qualifications  Degree qualified in Accountancy or Business with min 7 to 11 years of accounting experience  Experience in Financial Service/ banking is required  Experience in STF/Quant Trading/Treasury experience is preferred but not a must  Experience in setting up the finance function for a new business is preferred but not a must  Solid business and financial acumen  Has good process improvement methodologies  Constructively engage stakeholders to a common cause through developing mutually beneficial solutions and proposals.  Has ability to understand business needs and value drivers, and recommend appropriate process solutions while operating within the accounting framework  Strong credible communication and presentation skills;  Independent, assertive, and able to multi-task and prioritise commitments  Familiar with collaborative and innovative ways of working such as AgileTo apply, please send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com . Please also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv.We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.Posted by:CAP Consulting (EA license: 14C7175)Caroline Poh (EA Registration: R1105649)Date Posted - 16 Nov 2021

title: QA Engineer
description: We are seeking a QA Engineer responsible for the design and creation of test plans and test cases to identify bugs or issues with web and mobile applications. This position requires the creation of automated test cases and performing manual testing. The candidate should have a keen eye for details and be meticulous about writing reports and documentation.Overall Job ObjectivesEnsure that applications both web and mobile are thoroughly tested at all stages of deployment by leveraging a combination of QA best practices,  frameworks and automation tools. Ensuring that only high quality software products are shipped is of the utmost importance.Core Responsibilities | As a QA Engineer, you will:  Analyses requirements to develop and enhance software test plan for new features with systematic approach.  Perform software testing based on manual and/or automated test cases and analyzing and documenting test results.  Take full ownership of and maintain QA environment  Test product at all levels from user interface, workflows, application and performance.  Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with different teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.  Working closely with multi-site developers to design and create test conditions to address technical and customer use cases.  Prepare good analytical reports and to review findings with the team to recommend corrective action.  Provide support to the field service team for technical questions concerning software.  Have a good understanding of the software release cycle.Job Specifications | Requirements:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Software Engineering or related field.  Minimum 1 ‚Äì 3 years of relevant working experience in software QA.  Exceptional attention to details and quality.  Excellent analytical and problem solving skill, able to debug issues efficiently.  Great team player, proactive and able to work efficiently with minimal supervision.  Experience in eCommerce is a plus.  Should have coding experience and hands-on with automation (Web, Mobile app and API automation)  Knowledge of tools such as Postman, JMeter and TestComplete etc  Experience with CI/CD  Excellent communication, and analytical skills  Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies  Understanding of Java, Python, SQL, and JSON.

title: Photolithography Process Engineer/ Senior Engineer
description: Role  Responsibilities:  Analyze SPC charts using SPACE. Know all the PR rules and their significance. Do proper annotation to maintain quality troubleshooting rate for SPC OOC. Understand Cp and Cpk indices.  Monitor critical SPC charts daily. Perform process window study and provide improvement plan to reduce OOC and improve CPK.  Review ESPC charts using SPACE. Know all the rules for ESPC.  Analyze split lot, DOE data, ET, sort yield using JMP, Klarity ACE.  Create SPC charts, DCOP and modify SLDB using PROMIS (Si-View).  Upload recipe, check recipe and ensure recipe content compliance using RMS.  Raise PCRB and understands the requirements for PCRB opening, follow through with qual plan, analyze data using required software and CR closure.  Follow up on SPSR, MRB, 8D, TECN, or spec update with ECN.  Setup and troubleshoot issues in recipes/job files in all metrology tools within the Module. Do regular housekeeping of production job files.  Follow up on pass down to troubleshoot process issues. Establish CAS / procedures to be followed and work with other departments for resolution if required.  Startup and qualify new process and new equipment within scheduled timeline. Work closely with Equipment Engineer on new equipment acceptance. Know the concept of repeatability and reproducibility (RR) run.  Work on reducing process constraints so that Mfg can have more flexibility.  Perform process matching between equipment to reduce variation and analysis / DOE to find factors for better tool matching.  Participate in CIP programs to optimize process window, cost, yield, and productivity.  Work as a team with both Equipment and Mfg Engineers to meet Module objectives. Work to meet the key indices of Uptime and OEE goals.  Represent own Module to attend cross-functional task team to address yield improvement / excursion issues. Follow up with cross-fab benchmarking activities to engage the best-in-campus practices across fabs.  Self-audit and update specifications/documentation to meet TS16949 Quality Standard requirements.  Follow good housekeeping and safety rules in office and Fab.Requirements:  Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Mechanical / Microelectronics / Chemical Process Engineering / Chemistry / Physics.  At least 2 years semiconductor experience.  Project management skills and aptitude.  Good SPC knowledge.**To apply, please kindly email your updated resume to CV@copperco.com.sgWe regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.EA Personnel No. R1328116EA Licence No: 20C0333

title: Digital Marketing  Manager #SGUnitedMidCareerPathways
description: This   position reports to the Owner of SYMPHONY SCENTSATIONS. The digital marketing   manager will undergo on the job training with supervision from the owner.   He/she will be involved in the following activities such as executing the   organisation's branding and marketing efforts, protecting our brand image by   training key internal stakeholders on our brand guidelines, executing   marketing campaigns and digital marketing communications activities to   promote the organisation's product and service offerings, performing market   research and data analytics on brand awareness, market trends and target   buyer and seller landscapes to adjust marketing and communication plans,   doing competitor analysis to obtain insights on various promotions and   offerings execution approaches, developing relationships with advertising   agencies, external suppliers and key industry stakeholders by attending   networking events and staying informed with key trends in the industry.Individual   to be involved in:    1. Creating relevant content for our website.    2. Learn to launch paid ads campaigns on Facebook and Google to generate   targeted leads for our products and services.    3. Manage our social media profiles to increase customer engagement and get   referrals for our products and services.    4. Follow up with our leads from our online channels.    5. Develop marketing campaigns to increase customer retention and sales   opportunities.    6. Create online incentive programs to drive more sales.    7. Gather feedback from existing and potential customers.    8. Perform market research on our competitors to determine areas that we   can improve on.    9. Extracting data from Google Analytics to analyse the effectiveness of   our marketing campaigns.    10. Perform website audits to improve performance of website in terms of   user experience and to achieve higher rankings for keywords that are relevant   to our niche.1. Business Planning     - Active discussion with owner on how to brand our business online to   position it for growth and create a positive image.  2. Digital Marketing     - Learn how to create relevant content for our niche based on proper   keyword research.      - Launch Google Ads and Facebook Ads campaigns to generate leads for our   products and services based on keyword research, demographics research and   competitor analysis with tools like SEM Rush, Ahrefs and Google Keyword   Planner.   3. Social Media Management - Plan our weekly social media postings to   increase customer engagement and followers of our brand.      - Attend to enquiries on social media platforms from potential customers   and nurture relationships with existing followers.      - Come up with promotional marketing campaigns to increase sales   opportunities.  4. Customer Relationship Management - Be able to handle customers on social media   platforms professionally.     - Identify customer needs and provide appropriate solutions.      - Analyse data from paid ads on Google Ads and Facebook Ads platforms to   review effectiveness of marketing campaigns to come up with more effective   ones based on KPIs.  5. Market Research  - Use paid research tools like Ahrefs, SEMRush   and free ones like Google Keyword Planner and Google Trends to uncover new   marketing trends in the mobile phone niche that our company can take   advantage of to grow our revenue sources.   6. Marketing Campaign Management - Able to plan marketing campaigns based on   allocated budget to deliver measurable results based on best practices used   by top companies in our niche.Duration   of Attachment / Traineeship: 6 monthsAll Singaporeans and Permanent Residents are eligible for the programme, with the exception of recent graduates who should apply for the SGUnited Traineeships Programme instead.

title: Broker (Petrochem/Naphtha)
description: Corporate Culture and Guiding Principles:Tullett Prebon, part of TP ICAP group, operates at the heart of the world‚Äôs financial, energy and commodities markets.We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world‚Äôs financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy  Commodities.Globally, we are a leading provider of services to market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It‚Äôs supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities.We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity, and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.Responsibilities:  Promote Tullett Prebon as a company  Maintain and develop existing client relationships and make contact with prospective new clients where appropriate  Maintain an up to date knowledge of the products and markets in which you work; actively solicit feedback from industry participants through various means, including trade calls, surveys, industry events, trade shows and conferences  Understand the desk‚Äôs business strategy and seek to identify new business opportunities relating to trends, future markets, products and clients  On-board new clients following the correct process with the Client On-Boarding team  Assess client needs and financial conditions to identify internal cross selling opportunities  Understand pertinent regulation within the evolving regulatory landscape  Support a risk and compliance aware culture and comply with group policies  Exercise independent judgement and act with integrity, care, skill and diligence to avoid conflicts of interest and escalate issues as appropriateRisk Related Responsibilities:* Ensure that you understand the risks and controls on your desk; what could go wrong, what controls you have to prevent/detect or contain these.  Ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility  Report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/or your supervisor as described in the policy  Escalate risk events immediately and log them within 24 hours using the risk event capture form on the intranet  Provide input if requested to the Risk and Control Self-Assessment process, scenario analysis ‚ÄòDeep Dive‚Äô reviews and any other risk management processes as required.  Report all loss events, or near misses that could have resulted in a loss, in excess of the reporting threshold  Observe proper standards of market conduct and ensure you are aware of, understand and comply with all regulatory, exchange or clearing house requirements applicable to your role  Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines  Ensure that you adhere to the terms of any applicable Desk ManualRequired Registrations:To ensure the Group complies with its regulatory requirements, all employees performing regulatory or client facing roles need to be appropriately registered and authorised prior to dealing with or for its clients. Employees are responsible for assessing, in conjunction with their Line Manager and Compliance, whether they require authorisation by any supervisory body to perform a particular role. Prior to reviewing and confirming whether you are or require to be an approved person, please liaise with your Line Manager or speak with the Compliance Team.Person Specification:Client Focused  Personable and engaging  Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders  Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible  Demonstrates strong customer focus  Demonstrate ability to work effectively with others  Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution  Ability to work with diverse groups/ personalitiesInnovative  Open to innovative ideas/experiences and ability to create new ideas, approaches or insights  Seeks opportunities for improvements  Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativityDynamic  Competitive  Demonstrates high levels of energy in seeking out and achieving new goals  Goes that ‚Äúextra mile‚Äù  Is a self-starter  Shows evidence of being comfortable working in fast paced or pressured environments  Enjoys a challenge and is able to escalate  Does not give up easilyOpen  Communicative  Adapts communication style to suit audience  Projects personal credibility  Interacts confidently without being overbearing  Ability to work effectively in a high pressure environment  Keeps emotions under control in difficult situations  Handles criticism constructivelyProfessional Integrity  Able to demonstrate honesty, integrity and professionalism  Promotes loyalty to TP ICAP and its principles  Works ethically and shows respect for both professional and company valuesEffective  Excellent attention to detail, highly organised with a proactive approach  Strong analytical ability and problem solving skillsKnowledge  Understanding  Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy  Willingness to engage with internal and external stakeholders outside of the immediate desk environment  Prior experience in Energy  Commodities markets of 3 ‚Äì 5 years  Experience in Naphtha products an advantage but not necessary

description: As the Senior Analytics Manager at SpaceDC, you are responsible for our technical finance workstreams, processes, and policies. Accounting, Budgeting, Forecasting and Reporting:          Consolidating the full set of accounts, reporting packages and financial statements for the group.      Ensuring financial results are in accordance with local and regional statutory requirements and accounting principles on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.      Coordinating monthly, quarterly, and annual closing activities and preparing ad-hoc financial reports in a complete and timely manner.      Driving annual budgeting processes by preparing monthly forecasts and trends and projections for SpaceDC finances. Planning and managing FPA and Accounts Receivables functions.      We Are Looking For Candidates With:  At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accountancy/Finance/Business  Accountancy.  At least 15 years of experience in a similar role, preferably with experience working for a group company with multiple functional currencies.  Experience working in the data centre or energy sector.  Experience working with funding based companies, and an understanding of the complexities associated with external investors.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Excel.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English at the business level.  Good analytical and organisational skills, with an exceptional attention to detail.  Ability to learn, work and solve problems independently within time constraints.  Good leadership and interpersonal qualities, with high motivation and a strong sense of integrity.  High degree of commercial and business acumen.  The ability to manage and report CAPEX and OPEX.  Knowledge of ERP Accounting System.

description: ROLES  RESPONSIBILITIES  Manage and oversee project quality to ensure compliance to codes, standards, regulations, equipment specific specifications, and QMS requirements. description: Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Work with technology teams to design and implement reliable and scalable data pipelines. Proven track records working as Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Analyst or equivalent.  Good command of database structures and query languages.  Strong in Python programming and familiar with popular libraries such as Pandas, Scrapy.  Familiar with AWS Data Analytics service and setting up data pipelines, e.g. Airflow, Jenkins.  Knowledge of big data framework and tech stack is a plus, e.g. Spark, Hadoop.  Passion and curiosity for solving challenging problems by leveraging on the right technology.  Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-cultural team environment and lead changes.  Ability to work effectively with people at all levels ine an organization.  Ability to deliver sophisticated ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English.

title: Finance Director
description: As the Finance Director at SpaceDC, you are responsible for our finance workstreams, processes, and policies. You will prepare the full set of accounts, financial statements and reporting packages for our management and regulatory authorities. You are expected to maintain the accuracy and integrity of the financial records of the company and ensure that all organisational activities are properly accounted for in accordance with the existing accounting and tax regulations.Your Role Will Include:  Accounting, Budgeting, Forecasting and Reporting:          Consolidating the full set of accounts, reporting packages and financial statements for the group.      Ensuring financial results are in accordance with local and regional statutory requirements and accounting principles on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.      Coordinating monthly, quarterly, and annual closing activities and preparing ad-hoc financial reports in a complete and timely manner.      Driving annual budgeting processes by preparing monthly forecasts and trends and projections for SpaceDC finances.      Analysing financial information to develop procedural improvements and strategic recommendations, in correspondence with other departments.      Planning and managing FPA and Accounts Receivables functions.        Governance  Compliance:          Maintaining and improving strong internal control processes and process audits throughout the organisation.      Ensuring completeness and accuracy of documentation required for audits.      Implementing audit recommendations, where applicable.      Ensuring compliance with regulatory financial policies and procedures.      Ensuring compliance with relevant regulatory financial policies and procedures, such as the Accounting Standards, Tax and GST rules, and SpaceDC policies.        Controls and Process Improvements:          Contributing to accounting software and process improvement, by staying up to date with technological advances to be used for financial purposes.      Implementing internal control recommendations.        Assisting in any ad-hoc functions and related duties as and when assigned by management.We Are Looking For Candidates With:  At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accountancy/Finance/Business  Accountancy.  At least 15 years of experience in a similar role, preferably with experience working for a group company with multiple functional currencies.  Experience working with funding based companies, and an understanding of the complexities associated with external investors.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Excel.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English at the business level.  Good analytical and organisational skills, with an exceptional attention to detail.  Ability to learn, work and solve problems independently within time constraints.  Good leadership and interpersonal qualities, with high motivation and a strong sense of integrity.  High degree of commercial and business acumen.  The ability to manage and report CAPEX and OPEX.  Knowledge of ERP Accounting System.
